It suffices to show that $\triangle ABC$ is equilateral if and only if

By the theorem on determining from angles that a triangle is isosceles,
we conclude that $\triangle ABC$ is isosceles with legs
$\overline{AB} \cong \overline{AC}$ and that $\triangle BCA$ is
isosceles with legs $\overline{AC} \cong \overline{BC}$. Thus,
$\overline{AB} \cong \overline{AC} \cong \overline{BC}$. Hence,
$\triangle ABC$ is equilateral.
